website_summaries.verdict: If your ash removal needs are minimal, this ArmorAll wet/dry vacuum should fit the bill at a low price.
pros: For use in both wet and dry conditions
Automatically shuts off when it reaches its fill limit
cons: Plastic tank is not ideal for an ash vacuum
Some buyers said the suction in this option was poor

customer_reviews.title: Great for picking up my gsds hair
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum! Great for picking up my German Shepherds hair off of my trucks black seats. If you think that isn’t saying much just remember they don’t call them German shedders for no reason
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey B

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item 7 weeks ago and it just died today. This is the second time with this same vacuum that this happened (the first one died after 5 months).
customer_reviews.author: myg5

customer_reviews.title: Great but really loud.
customer_reviews.text: Did a really good job of lifting pet hair from my car! Check out the comparison on the picture I submitted. That was after a year of not vacuuming my car and I only did a quick clean. The only negative is it's LOUD. I actually had to put on ear plugs. I can't imagine anyone using this on a daily use without ear protection. And I hope I didn't bother the neighbors since I did it in the garage with the garage door open. Otherwise a great product for a great price. Another random positive is I used the blower function to dry my dog after a bath!
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo AR

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but here's how to upgrade to a "real" filter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum to get debris out of small cracks and tracks in the floor of our office space and to suck up the odd toner spill. Problem is, toner is too fine a particle for the supplied "sock" filter. So, I did some measuring and research and found that the following two items allow this vac to use a proper, HEPA "shop vac small canister size" filter: SHOP VAC Replacement Retainer Nut for Small Cartridge Filter 3183000 (~$4.00)  Shop-Vac 9039700 Ultra Web Small Cartridge Filter, Type BB (~$9.00)  Does it decrease suction? Meh, maybe a little bit?
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Chirdon

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this vacuum at first
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this vacuum at first. However, after only a few months of very light uses, the suction started to become weak. I changed the cloth filter and that helped a little - so I was somewhat content. Then, when using the vacuum to cleanup a small amount of saw dust, the motor completely stopped working. ... so that was the end of its life.
customer_reviews.author: RL in MD

customer_reviews.title: Keep upright to prevent spills.
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing every week to clean out my 18 wheeler. The selection of brushes that comes with it are nice but I would recommend purchasing a more detailing brush set. The vac itself is great. Only reason for 4 stars is the fit and finish of the closing mechanism. The plastic latches that hold the bottom on are kind of a pain to get lined up all the time and sometimes when the vac is tipped over the top separates from the bottom dumping the vacuumed up stuff onto the floor. Keep it upright and its good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jon H.

customer_reviews.title: This vaccum sucks them all up with no problem very quickly
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this for animal cleanup. We have 2 guinea pigs and I use fleece liners in their cage, so their poops just sit on top. It was a pain to sweep them up twice a day. This vaccum sucks them all up with no problem very quickly. I am impressed. It does not do well when I accidently suck up a bit of hay, but that is not surprising. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: There's literally no suction. I'm a clean aholic so I keep vacumns everywhere . This thing is junk with a capital J!
customer_reviews.author: Donald L. Blazek

customer_reviews.title: Complete piece of crap! Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Complete piece of crap! Do not buy. Received Jan 18, 2017 and went up in smoke April 28, 2017 after light use. Was used probably 2 times a month since purchase vacume small staircase. Cheap Chinese garbage
customer_reviews.author: Arnold P.

customer_reviews.title: Dead after two years of light use
customer_reviews.text: After using this occasionally for two years, the suction power is now almost non-existent even with the filter bag and input hose disconnected. This is surprising as this was used once every couple weeks to clean off a workbench or car floor mats.
customer_reviews.author: B. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Leaf blower.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to vacuum leaves off my outdoor rug. Not the right machine for this, as the hose is not wide enough for many leaves, and they will get stuck in there. HOWEVER, when I decided to give that idea up and use as a leaf blower, I loved it. Along with the extension wands and an extension cord, I was able to clean up the entire patio and the carport in about an hour---both were a mess of leaves and other natural debris. This machine has an amazing amount of blowing power, and is not even as noisy as a household vacuum. I am very happy with this as a leaf blower.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Cheap shop vac
customer_reviews.text: Only used a handful of times and it no longer works. It still comes on but there's no suction. Great that it broke just past the return period. Since I got it to work a few times, I know I had it closed/sealed properly. It was good when it worked; good suction and the cord is long enough to easily use. Easy to open and empty.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great for high shedding pet cleanup on hardwood floors and furniture.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Large Fluffy Dog, and as anyone with a Large Fluffy Dog can attest, you need to vacuum up the fluffy tumbleweeds regularly during shedding season (honestly all spring and all fall). I bought this little guy so I wouldn't have to drag the big shop vac up from the basement every week. Pros: Lightweight, powerful, reusable filter bags Cons: Short hose, short accessories, short cord I hopped online and purchased a long crevice tool because I was getting back pain stooping down to vacuum all the hair. I will also be buying an extension tube to help me even more.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki Von Pants

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to find this little vacuum to keep in the garage for use on the car and boat. Do not waste your time! The vacuum arrived quickly. Everything was in great shape. Set it up and started vacuuming my car- which I might add rarely is ever that dirty. I completed the backseat and floorboard area, moved to the front, and it quit. Cannot get it to come back on. Tried different switches in garage and then kitchen to make sure I didn't trigger a breaker or anything. Even had my dad is is handy with mechanical stuff take a look. Brand new vacuum and it's in the trash! Do not waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Atl_guy87

customer_reviews.title: Overall, great multipurpose sucker!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a shop vac with some serious suction, but also portable for my car. This thing has the suction I was hoping for. It does great on anything around the workshop, almost sucked up my pencil once by accident so make sure you keep your small scraps and parts clear. It worked well on long carpet, but with just hose suction it wasn't as perfect as my normal house vacuum. However, on low car carpet, it was perfect! And the accessories that come with it are already car-cleaning ready.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Far too weak
customer_reviews.text: For its size and the fact that it's powered, this has a very weak suction. Not even strong enough to clean out my rabbit's pen (bits of hay and pellets are too heavy for it). I would say it might be good for cars, but it doesn't have a car adapter. So if that's what you want it for, you'll need to buy one yourself. I really have no idea what I could actually use this thing for that it would properly clean around the house. Maybe my chair.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M. White

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but quite impractical.
customer_reviews.text: The format, size, suction power and cord length are all great. However, the suction tube and the accessories hold together by friction only, and keep getting detached as you use them (-1). The suction tube itself is not particularly supple and requires you to move it frequently to access the spots you want to clean (-1). One of the accessories, the brush, perhaps the most useful accessory, consists of two pieces that will always detach themselves on lateral movements, making the brush practically useless (-1). Overall, you spend half your time reconnecting the suction tube and accessories together when you use it. Making the suction tube supple and using connectors to hold everything together would make this tool fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: The 6th Rider

customer_reviews.title: Good vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum is descent, the cord is a bit too short. Suction is strong and enough to pick up the usual debris in the car. I was disappointed I received the product in a box without the original retail box or any wrappings. I had to double check to make sure I had everything that was suppose to come with it. Couldn't tell if it was used or not, it looked clean so I disregard the fact. Just disappointing Amazon is selling opened box items.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived used- With dirt and hair balls inside.
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum cleaner arrived used and dirty. Dirty as in with a full hair ball and lots of dirt. To make matters worse, whoever used it, didn't install the filter correctly; therefore, there is hair and dirt inside the motor assembly. When I tested it, the exhaust hole blew a big puff of dirt. It still works, but it should not have been sold as new. I won't go through the trouble of returning it, but it deserves noting that the company selling this product is not being honest or at least QC'ing their products.
customer_reviews.author: S. Arias

customer_reviews.title: Compact But Packs A Punch
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small shop vac that could vacuum my cars, suck up spills, and occasionally cobwebs without it being too large. And wow this shop vac is perfect !!! I was shocked at how good that it still sucked up dirt and liquid with its small size. It doesn't have wheels but it's small and compact which makes them irrelevant in my opinion. You just easily pick it up by it's handle and walk away. Doesn't take up much space at all in my garage. You could even easily leave it in your car's trunk too if you liked. For the price and quality this was a perfect buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: David hicks

customer_reviews.title: It sucks, just not enough.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice vacuum that is in-between a regular vacuum and a shop vacuum. With the amount of suction this provides, I don't think it classifies as a shop vac. The attachments, cord length, and weight are all great. The issue for me is that it just doesn't have enough suction to do what a shop vac does. I bought this to clean my car and light garage cleanup, I thought it would be perfect. When cleaning my car I found that it still left a good bit behind, mind you it did clean much more than my household vacuum but I was left feeling unsatisfied after. Returned, I will be investing in a full size shop vac.
customer_reviews.author: Richard N.

customer_reviews.title: Great little shop vac!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing suction! We had a rental SUV while ours was getting fixed, and took it on a camping trip with our kids and GSD. Pretty sure we weren't supposed to have dogs in the rental so I had to vacuum to leave as little evidence as possible. My kid also dumped a box of Cheerios in the back seat. This unit did a great job sucking up everything and I'm very happy I bought it. The power cord is longer than I was expecting (good thing) and it comes with a good variety of attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha F.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t lose the wet filter. Put it somewhere in a labeled little bag.
customer_reviews.text: Got this today. A day earlier than expected. Used it right away. It has very good suction power. I like everything about it. It is light weigh and was easy to pick up and carry around. The attachments are perfect especially that little brush. (I may wear this little thing out) It’s goi g to Be perfect for the car. An aside: thanks to the thief who took my big shop vac I had to get this and I love it. The old shop vac was 20 years old without any attachments and the top would come off when picked up. Good luck with it thief. I like my new one.
customer_reviews.author: SDS

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning up Cat Vomit
customer_reviews.text: Since I JUST steam cleaned my carpets before X-Mas company, I bought this solely for the purpose of cleaning up my cat's digestive incidents. Gone are the days of setting up Cone Zones and waiting for it dry so I can clean with the vacuum (still doesn't remove the odor) Half the time I ended up stepping in it anyway and smushing it deeper into the carpet. My big criteria was suction, and form factor. It was between this and The Stinger at HD. This one had more attachments and also a seal between the two sections. I just finished a trial run, and I must say this has exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: mlb6d9

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Suction
customer_reviews.text: I love this little vacuum. Even though it feels a bit flimsy storing the parts on top of the machine, this vacuum really sucks (and not in a bad way!) It reminds me of the vacuums at a DIY car wash that you pay to use. The vacuum is light weight and easy to carry. The only thing I really don't like about it is the length of the cord. I always have to get an extension cord out when cleaning my car.
customer_reviews.author: Bradenton Tim

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my car and couches! I use an extension cord to reach my car and indoors don’t need one. Lots of suction heads to choose from. I like the biggest one and the smallest one. Not exactly sure how to use the ones with a brush on their heads. Has kept me away from those cheap car washes. Made the switch to washing my own car with waterless and Optimum No Rinse applications and now thanks to the shop vac I have NO reason to go back! So much nicer to just have my own car vacuum! Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Wallace

customer_reviews.title: I kept but you should find a different option!
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure, I kept this product but don’t necessarilyknow why...possibly because the options for a compact wet-vac are so limited. I love me the concept but it’s a poor design that’s riddled with flaws from SO many inside-the-hopper structural areas that dirt and gunk get hung up on to a couple of tue attachments that don’t even work. Stay away and find another option.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Sarnow

customer_reviews.title: Burning smell
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum was delivered outside of the original box. When I used it for first time had a burning smell. I paid for a NEW item...Did I get a returned/used one? I received all items listed as accessories and received on timely matter (2 stars for that)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressive suction power considering need for AC power
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping the need to plug in to an outlet would be a trade-off for very good suction power. Suction is unimpressive. Gets the job done but only with great effort/repetition. The accessories are oddly designed such that I need to continuously press on the to keep the from falling off while in use. The cord is long, but I still need an additional extension cable to reach every part of my car(which I park directly in front of my front door). Ability to suck and blow is nice. It works, but isn't the solution I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Foley

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts - My mistake
customer_reviews.text: Showed up in a plain box with no hose. Looks like half the other parts are missing too. Amazon tried to contact Armor All for me but they are closed. Ridiculous. UPDATE: I am ridiculous! The hose is INSIDE the vacuum along with attachments. I think I was thrown off because it was not in a manufacture's box or packaged in any way. Just loose in a cardboard box. But it works like a charm so I don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little vacuum!  Powerful, well equipped and light weight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum primarily to use in my car. I have 3 big dogs that get really dirty and ride in my car almost daily. In spite of my cargo liner, dirt and hair are a constant problem. Now I have a way to clean my car that works better than either my household canister vacuum (an expensive one), or the clunky quarter-fed vacuums at the car wash. This vacuum has powerful suction and a great assortment of attachments, so I was even able to vacuum the small spaces beside the seats, inside the cupholders and door wells, and around the gear shift. It far exceeded my expectations and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: KP in Portland

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have dieds after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2018 with pretty decent regular use, about once a week shared between 2 people. Suction was great, easy to clean but very loud. Now it barely sucks up fuzz. Seemed to start having issues after my roommate got a cat and started to suck up cat litter but not sure if that was the cause maybe 3 years is its life span.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Clunky Top
customer_reviews.text: I like the long hose and cord. It sucks as good as my old shop vac and has a nice detail tool. If it wasn't for the lid fitting securely I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Suction isn't great, get what ya pay for
customer_reviews.text: I used this just for a simple vacuum of my vehicle. It's been a while and I'm a cig smoker so it really needed it. The suction was less than impressive and the cord wasn't a hit. Nice to have all the different tops but it's almost like they make the suction worse. Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.author: susan fleming

customer_reviews.title: Had this for years and finally ready to leave a review.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this vac for a few years for my various NYC apartments, and it has been a bit less convenient than an upright. However, I wanted a shop vac (wet/dry) so I could use it for spills, and I wanted something that I could hook up to power tools easily... Finally, I'm leaving a review because I just discovered it's perfect for unclogging drains. I've had a slow drain in my current apartment's bathroom sink since I moved in a year and a half ago. Recently it went from slow to molasses, and I used this vacuum to clear it out! Fast as ever now.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Shufro

customer_reviews.title: A very well made shop/wet vac.
customer_reviews.text: I am a CNC Machine Operator and maintenance man. I use this on a daily basis for sucking up hydraulic oils and lubricants often with metal shavings. It’s easy, portable and so far... it’s better than any wet vac I have previously encountered. I know it says Armor on it, but who every made it for them, should sell their own brand. It’s just that good. Everything is well thought out from the inside to the outside. Especially hose and power cord storage when it goes back on the shelf. I like it a lot, and so do my co-workers.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Orlowe

customer_reviews.title: Easily Justify Your Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My wife wasn't going to let me buy this. But then I explained how I can shampoo and scrub the carpet in her SUV since this sucks up the suds and water. She said okay and I was so happy! Even though I had to clean her car, this has been one of the best purchases I've made for my garage!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great for home/garage and small needs.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for detailing your car, small messes, or generally keeping in a work space like small wood working or electronics. Would not recommend for commercial applications or constant usage. Cleaned two vehicles back-to-back with no problems. Heavy soiling may require extra time or a larger unit though. Attachments work great, machine is light to carry, and seems pretty durable for what it it. Note: made by a larger name manufacturer for ArmorAll, but at a cheaper price that their name brand version. Do some research. You are welcome.
customer_reviews.author: B. LeMeilleur

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the detailing vehicles!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for detailing cars. The tiny attachments help to clean out those hard to reach areas inside of the vehicles. It has a good suction to it. Also, if something gets stuck inside of the hose... I have literally just stuck the hose into the "blower" part on the back & blown debris right out of it rather than struggling to reach inside the tube to dislodge debris.
customer_reviews.author: PugMom411

customer_reviews.title: very powerful doesn't take a lot of closet room to store :)
customer_reviews.text: Handy dandy vacuum. I have a Roomba and this hand vacuum to do non-floor vacuuming jobs and I love it. It's on the smaller size but it's definitely powerful! Sucks everything up whether you like it or not. I gave 4 stars because cleaning the filter is a bit yacky. I have a lot of dust in my house and the filter gets so dusty that I have to go outside to clean it. I do it with a little floor hand brush. It's the easiest way.
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: Great vac
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure about the reviews from people who are not satisfied with the suction? I’ve use this thing now for quite a while and the suction on it is fantastic. Is it the suction of a shop vac? Of course not, but if I wanted the suction of a shop vac I would’ve purchased one. I bought this little vacuum cleaner for its portability/ease of use and it does a great job on my four-door car and my wife’s large SUV. In fact, I was actually pleasantly surprised at how good it did work considering it’s cheap price range. So glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Dirtysouth2000

customer_reviews.title: Love this Vac
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time and neatly package with all new contents, I think selected standard boxing, Which might means in a box other than Printed Name brand box items normally package in this does not mean the item wont be new unless stated ( used ) just box in a plain brown box no pictures or labels of the item until you open the box. Its a new thing now case you never seen this option, In some cases its cheaper to go with no label boxing. Ok So back to the product Love its the best car vac so far i like it.
customer_reviews.author: MzMeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Get's the job done ....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lil guy so that I can keep my patio clean (picking up leaves and debris on the floor, removing copious amounts of dog hair from outdoor sectional) and for quick car cleans. I used it the day it arrived! Very easy to put together, and just LOVE the compact size. Suction power was perfect for what I need (it's obv. not quite that of a full size wet/dry vac .. but that's expected) - and the variety of accessory heads that came with is brilliant - I can get into all the appropriate nooks and crannies, while using the wider accessory to clean up the outdoor rug and gather the dog hair in one swoop. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kathy davies

customer_reviews.title: Depends on what you want to use it for
customer_reviews.text: The suction power is just okay. More importantly I wanted to keep this device on my sailboat to suction the water out of the bilge every time we have a heavy rain. This device only holds less than half the volume of water to it’s container size, very disappointing. This means frequent stops to empty the water, exactly what I was trying to avoid.. further as a car vac the attachments don’t fit those nooks where small stuff collects and the suction power is not strong enough to compensate for the attachments design. This vacuum performed well picking up broken door window glass.
customer_reviews.author: domestic deva

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Shop Vac
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful, lightweight sweeper with a nice long cord and an assortment of attachment for cleaning. It is far better than the shop vac I previously owned ( I gave it to my son). I had an old Dirt Devil that gave up the ghost, but I kept the floor attachment. I paired it up with the Armor All sweeper and use it as a tank sweeper for floors. Great little machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Call me shortee
customer_reviews.text: At this time the worst issue is the abbreviated cord length. Cleaning is no problem as I bought the VacMaster 2.5-3.2 bags that attach to the in-port and dump all waste right into the bag. No clean-up. I have more than enough power to clean the cat little that they leave on the steps after coming out of the box, the hair that someone rips out of their head when they comb'brush to look GREAT for the world each day. Truth be told, it seems to be about as powerful as my 15 gallon shop vac. Nice machine as I work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Opa Craig

customer_reviews.title: It is okay, but only just
customer_reviews.text: I probably expected a little too much from this vac... I sometime get a little water in my basement and wanted to use this to get it up quickly after rain storms, but the supposed 2.5 gallon bucket doesn't seem to hold that much so I have to empty it often. And since the pick up hose is connected to the bucket, it becomes a pain to empty the buck with the hose attached. For me (and cleaning up water), I wish I'd spent a little more and got one with a larger collection bucket.
customer_reviews.author: John Carter

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has good suction power and is easy to use.. I used this vacuum 2.5 times and it just stopped working, I thought I blew a fuse but no, this vacuum just stopped working... Called under armor customer service and was given the “run around “. Luckily Amazon is replacing this unit... So I will try the next unit and review, it’s possible I just got a bad unit. The best thing about this purchase is the return process with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: IRISH

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction, works well
customer_reviews.text: Great price and perfect for spills and water leakage. Great suction. Had to use when AC overflowed in the basement. It only sucks up about a gallon at a time and you have to dump the tank frequently. if You don’t mind the size then it’s great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: shanika80

customer_reviews.title: Works well, Pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to regularly clean out a pellet grill without having to bring out a regular large shop vac Used it right after I received and It handled the task very easily and quickly. Took me longer to get the grates and tray out. Will it suck up nails and other stuff like a std. shop vac? Probably not efficiently but I wasn't expecting that from this small unit. For light tasks I think this thing will make easy work of it. Tried the blower feature and it wasn't noteworthy in either respect. But, don't plan on using that feature. I'm very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: lopag

customer_reviews.title: Good suction and useful attachments
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good car vac for home use and at the $40 price range I am pleased with it's performance. It has a longer power cord and hose than other similar vacs which allows you reach all around the interior and under seats much easier. It has multiple accessories which are very handy for cleaning in the tight places between and under the seats. I really like the small detail brush attachment. It is great for cleaning the dashboard and dash controls and the console cup holders. I highly reccomend :)
customer_reviews.author: Jr72

customer_reviews.title: Used regularly, works great
customer_reviews.text: I use this vacuum a lot and it works great. I use it to vacuum out my car regularly (I have four kids), the couch regularly (again, I have four kids), the window channels in my home during spring cleaning I also use it to inflate my air mattress. I’ve used it to vacuum up a wet spot once in my carpet and it worked great for that too. If I had known how useful it would be I would have bought it a long time ago. If it ever quits I’d buy it again in a heartbeat. The shipping box did arrive pretty bashed, but the contents seemed fine and it’s been working great since I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: The Book Reader

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Viking gas cook top with four burners in my kitchen. The burners sit in pairs over top of a sunken pan to collect boiled over liquids and what have you. For years I have hated to clean my cook top because of the difficulty removing the dirtied cleaning solution and miscellaneous food tidbit. Now, cleaning my cook top is a cinch with this delightful small wet/dry vac. It took me years to give myself permission to splurge on this purchase. I wish I hadn't waited so long! Cleaning the container and wet filter are also a cinch. I highly recommend this wet/dry vac for small household cleaning projects
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Porter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and function - 5 years and going strong
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to help clean up kid debris in our vehicles but find we use this on most every job around the house. It's lightweight and has powerful suction which make it ideal for cleaning vents, stairs, couches, glitter, cat food mess... I break this out far more than our larger shop size vacuum. I dropped it off a ladder and broke the handle not long after we bought it...I hot glued it back together and thought that if it didn't work, then I'd just buy another brand to try out...so glad it held and we had time to use it.... and it's still is holding - highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable car and shop unit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to have a smaller unit to attach to scroll and chop saw along with spot cleanup and car cleanup. Works perfectly and is light enough to carry around as needed. Good suction, and easy remove top to dump waste. Comes with foam and paper filters, which are easy to remove. Paper filter clogs pretty quick when using fine dust items and its difficult to completely clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Scott

customer_reviews.title: Dust flies everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean a grill. The ash dust flew everywhere. Then I tried to use it inside. The dust of what I vaccuumed and pieces flew everywhere. I threw it in the trash. Don’t buy this vacuum it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy F

customer_reviews.title: This thing is GREAT. Very powerful for it's small size
customer_reviews.text: This thing is GREAT. Very powerful for it's small size. I use this for detailing cars, cleaning up the garage as you can also use this to blow out leaves and other debris, and other around the house jobs . Even used it to suck up all the water from a washing machine that broke. Easily portable and the attachments come in really handy. Small size allows me to store it away on a garage shelf.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Not that powerful to me
customer_reviews.text: The hose is small and no other parts come with it to adjust to at least a few more size adaptors. I need it to blow water/air out of a 3-4 ft piping into a pool to winterize pool and didn’t work for me. Keeping because of price and it might be helpful for someone else in my community. Would not buy again. Ke
customer_reviews.author: Ms Kekee

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned up 4 years worth of dirt!
customer_reviews.text: This small vaccum works AMAZINGLY! Don't look any further this one is for you! If it can vaccum up 4 years of dirt & junk in my car (gross I know, but with 2 toddlers it's hard to go get the car vaccumed). I knew we had built up some dirt and this little vaccum got it all! The inside of my car looks brand new again with some added unkown stains. Haha. If you need this vaccum to vaccum your normal dirty car it'll get it done! The suction is GREAT! I was very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Jones

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working in 9 months
customer_reviews.text: The mini vac works for approx 9 months , then the suction power is gone. I maintained it properly , cleaning it , using the correct bags etc. . I don’t know why it stopped working , I think I got a lemon, I would not recommend this, sure it feels like you’re saving money ....., are you ? your trading a monetary victory for future frustration and buyers remorse. Some sellers are just dumping a discontinued failed models on the consumer. That’s what I believe is happening here.
customer_reviews.author: billy freeze

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. I was a little worried it wouldnt work because the lid doesn’t seal down to the bottom but I’ve used it to clean the car, cat litter messes, to clean after removing a carpet, and to clean my rats cage. I did buy an extension for the cord. Great size lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great little shop vac
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum is great for cleaning cars we use it also for the camper and small spills around the house I originally bought it for a small lightweight vacuum to vacuum up bird food and feathers for my indoor bird cage because when you try and seeep it feathers fly everywhere I would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Shop Vac
customer_reviews.text: I like this vacuum. It is replacing one I have used for about 10yrs. This one has great suction, it was surprising. I will use this for vacuuming my truck interior, and also to clean around my fireplace insert. I appreciate the supplied tools, included all are useful. My only criticism is a minor one. I found the hose to seem to be a bit thin. It dosn't affect the operation however. The hose length makes up for the fact that it is light weight. I hope with proper care and cleaning it lasts sometime.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Williams

customer_reviews.title: Description misleading - only picks up 1.5 gallon.
customer_reviews.text: The description says it has a 2.5-gallon capacity, but when picking up water, it will only pick up 1.5 gallons before turning off. It has to be emptied after a few seconds and the lid is very difficult to get off. The "snaps" are very stiff. Worthless for doing even the small jobs as a wet vac.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this over a month. I’ve used it with both settings, set and dry. The suction is powerful, it gets the tiniest pieces in the carpet of my Jeep. The bucket is large and I doubt anyone will ever fill it using the wet vacuum. The attachments that it comes with are practical. I just wish the cord was longer... it’s not short, but I use this vac to clean our cars so the longer the cord the better. But over all, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Sasa

customer_reviews.title: Good Vac
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hoping for a little more suction than my last shop vac, and while this one has generally the same sucking power it did come with plenty of accesories which was quite beneficial considering many vacuums do not come with all of the 'bells and whistles" since the seller usually wants to try and get you to purchase them separately. Very pleased with the vac and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda & Seth

customer_reviews.title: less than a gallon
customer_reviews.text: it is advertised as 2.5 gallon capacity and it is more like 3L this thing was a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M

customer_reviews.title: for the smallest of jobs
customer_reviews.text: Not knowing heads or tails about wet/dry utility vacs I ordered this off amazon thinking it would solve a few issues my regular vacuum couldn't handle. Arrived on time (yay) works (yay) is easy to find in the garage bc its bright orange (yay) but the suction power leaves a lot to love. Comes with a variety of attachments and works fine but I really needed a high velocity vac to clean the car - I'll keep this one bc I'm too lazy to repackage and return but if I knew then what I know now I wouldn't have purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, good bargain for price
customer_reviews.text: Suction power was definitely adequate for car use and got the job done very well however, it was not quite as powerful as my 90’s era upright Hoover model. Cord length was just long enough but the hose extension could have been slightly longer, although it did work well for my needs (Honda Civic). Construction was flimsy and 100% plastic with closures that didn’t seem like they made the best seal around the vacuum body.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer9388

customer_reviews.title: Blown away by the power
customer_reviews.text: Tried this vacuum for the first time and was blown away. Then I realized I had the hose in the exhaust hole and reconnected it. Now I'm blown away by the suction. Really incredible. Used it on dry vac to pick up baking soda on a rug (don't ask) and it was shockingly strong. I got it for the car and I'm certain it'll do the job. It's very light to carry. Super easy to put together and empty. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Len Overton

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful and has several good attachments
customer_reviews.text: Awesome vacuum. Has several assorted attachments for getting into different areas. I primarily bought it to clean out our vehicles, but it will work for smaller house messes too when a large vac isn't needed. I haven't used the wet vac portion yet, it comes with a filter for dry messes and a foam filter for wet use. The cord is longer than expected and the hose is a decent length. It also has a holder for the hose on the sides so it wraps up nicely. This is a great product at a reasonable price point.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Vogl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for car and guinea cages
customer_reviews.text: This is the best car vacuum I have ever owned. The suction power is pretty dang awesome for its size. Easy to store in the garage and not take up a ton of space. I bought a second one to to clean my guineas cage. It’s perfect for that too, if anyone needed one for that.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stalcup

customer_reviews.title: Great Suction Power
customer_reviews.text: I spent the winter on a Texas beach my truck was full of sand I was tired of going to the car wash to vacuum the truck. I order the vacuum and had it delivered to the R.V. park it worked great to get the sand out of the truck, the vacuum came with many different attachments making to easy to clean the sand out of all the places it gets into. I will carry it with me when I travel.
customer_reviews.author: Yankedog

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning power is extremely good.
customer_reviews.text: This Vacuum is extremely powerful and performs above any other that I have had. It’s suction power is extremely good. After the first Cleaning you can already notice the difference. This item also has the ability to suck in water with out being damage just make sure you change the blue filter to the black one. Overall this item is great for car detailing and any form of cleaning in any surface.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: I gave it the most impossible task, and it completed it.
customer_reviews.text: Just walked back into the house after having this little guy suck up over 25 gallons of rain water from an outdoor tool shed in my back yard. No problems or hiccups along the way. Note that even though it's 2.5 gallons, the vacuum probably only holds about half of that liquid volume before it stops. If you're trying to move large volumes of water, I would try something else. But in general this small vacuum will finish your task and has a ton of great attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: I liked it. It has enough suction
customer_reviews.text: I liked it. It has enough suction, and does a good job. You are just not going to get the same suction from a 2 hp that you are going to get from a 6 hp. Some of the reviews complain about poor suction from a small portable vac. This does a fine job for a $30 vac. I was looking at the Milwaukee 18v for $99 without battery or charger. You're looking at $200 dollars for the package. I can buy 6 of these for that, and I doubt the Milwaukee performs much better.
customer_reviews.author: BHG

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty powerful compare to other completions. I like the fact that it attaches to the power outlet and not the car battery. It's light compact and easy to use. The power cord hiwcer is too short, you can obviously use an extension cord to solve the problem. As far as suction, I give it a 4 out 5 as it is indeed powerful enough for a tiny machine. It won't really help too much with pet hair though, everything else, it is just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: sarahm

customer_reviews.title: Love this little Vac!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vacuum to help with cleaning my house after a bathroom renovation. I needed something to help clean off all the renovation dust off high surfaces--it worked perfectly. While working on high surfaces, I used a strip of duct tape to hold it on the ladder tray so I could use both hands to vacuum. Vacuuming out cabinets was a breeze. When I wiped the surfaces with a damp rag, there was very little residue left. I've used every attachment while vacuuming, and it work every well. While I haven't used it for wet vacuuming yet, I have no doubt it will work well. This is a great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: gecko gal

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: It lasted less than 6 months, I used it like 4 times then it died when I called the company 3 different times they put me on ignore for over 30 minutes each time
customer_reviews.author: Tim Eggleston

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on 9/29/2019 and we tried using it in january and it is no longer working. Do yourself a favor and save your money. Go to home depot and buy something better. So mad I wasted my hard earned money on this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Glendalys

customer_reviews.title: Big power, small package.
customer_reviews.text: I chose the ArmorAll 2hp 2.5gal wet/dry vacuum over other popular brands in the same price range here. It has the switch right on top in the handle. I can grab it up with my left, clean the truck floors and seats with my right, switch it on and off without putting it down. Other car vacuums I have get too hot and take two hands to switch off. My hope is this one will fit my quick maintain it clean style.
customer_reviews.author: F. Bombe

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this Armor vacuum because of good reviews but I am much more impressed than I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used a house vacuum to clean my car for years. I purchased this Armor vacuum because of good reviews but I am much more impressed than I thought I'd be. The vacuum power is extremely strong, it has a very long hose and many great attachments. I was able to clean my car much more thoroughly than ever before. For $29 this vacuum is a steal. I gave away my old house vacuum I used for car cleaning and will give this unit as a Christmas gift next year. Only issue I have found is hose is harder and stiffer than I'd like, otherwise an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Perfect size and weight for easy mobility like doing vehicles. Got to test it out right after I got it for a flooded floor of my car so glad I bought this. Sucked all the water out got about a quarter of the tanks worth great suction. Also tested the dry vac on some powder in my grandma's car and cleaned it perfect. Very impressed and came with clear directions and all the attachments
customer_reviews.author: Julie Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great for other uses
customer_reviews.text: Thousands have written about how great the Armor All vac is for car cleaning. It is also great on garage floors and interior wood floors. To make it even more usefull, I brought an extension wand and a swivel-head hard floor brush. Adding stick-on sliding pads to the bottom of the collection tank ensures that it slides along well without scratching the floor. I also found that the flat deluxe car nozzle also fits into the dyer vent to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Gwbenns

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper!!
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered today and I immediately cleaned the inside of my car and this thing works great! I was amazed at the suction power. It's lightweight and perfect for an old lady like me. Nifty little gadget....😊 I love it! Thank you Amazon for carrying the best products!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but Mighty
customer_reviews.text: Great for maneuvering in small areas like the car, stairs or laundry room. It's lightweight, so it's easy to carry or lift so you can reach tight spots. The various attachments pretty much work for any job unless you really need to clean something heavy duty, but that's not what this vacuum is for anyway. My only complaint is that I wish the cord was longer, but it's relatively minor. Easy to clean out and the filter works well and is pretty easy to wash up. You can order additional filters if you like.
customer_reviews.author: Windinmyhair

customer_reviews.title: Nice size but dust chamber does not seal when holding by handle.
customer_reviews.text: Nice size and design, with a flaw.. when holding by handle, the bottom chamber comes immediately unsealed with no added weight, exposing a leak for dust to come thru. This happens when it is locked.. see video. Purchased because old vaccuum was leaking dust, so problem still here.
customer_reviews.author: Garry B Sears

customer_reviews.title: Better than Car Wash Vacuums
customer_reviews.text: This has very good sucky sucky, not great sucky but very good. Not impressed but pleased. It’ll do just as well as other lower or midrange vacuums but absolutely perfect for basic car vacuuming. I have a dog that sheds a great deal and it picks up the hair just fine. You still need to put your back into it and takes multiple swipes to get an area but beats the car wash vacuums.
customer_reviews.author: K.Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great for my pickup and for camping use
customer_reviews.text: I found this little vacuum to be great for cleaning out my truck and for camping. Before I setup camp in my roof top tent I hook it up to my trucks inverter and clean out the floor of the tent before laying down the sleeping bags. The cord was sufficient length to get from the inverter in my pickup bed to the tent about 9 ft up.
customer_reviews.author: ohms

customer_reviews.title: Super Duper Happy
customer_reviews.text: This product has fantastic suction and great tools for car detailing, especially for about $45. As expected, you will likely need an extension cord unless you park your car right next to an outlet. Seriously, don't bother looking at other products unless you want to pay a fortune for something that is likely not much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Great suction
customer_reviews.text: Was worried the suction power wouldn’t be as good because of the size, but wow it works great! Picked up all of the dog hair in my back seat from my German Shepard! Love the lightweight feel.
customer_reviews.author: Marianna

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend. Worth the extra $9 Dollars
customer_reviews.text: Hesitated before buying this little dynamo because there was another brand-named vacuum that looked similar for $9 less. But read the reviews and remembered that cheap doesn't mean quality. Well very happy that I followed my gut and bought this one. Super powerful. I use it in the pet room just to pick up stray cat litter. But it picks up everything else too including imbedded pet hair. The 3 tools they give you with it all really work well. And the cord is long enough to reach all around the 10X10 room. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little Vac!
customer_reviews.text: Love this vac! I purchased the vac to pick up liquid mess and it exceeded my expectation. My air conditioner started to retain water and the water eventually leaked into the room because a bird's nest blocked the drain hole. This vac extracted almost a gallon of water from the a/c within a few minutes. It's light, portable and packs a lot of power for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Best little machine ever.
customer_reviews.text: This little vac is a workhorse. Very light, easy to use. I bought it to clean up after my messy birds. I also bought the extension tube so I can reach under things better. I highly recommend this product. It works great for cleaning our car.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryne Eschenburg

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough to clean car floor
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would be a good replacement over paying to use the vacuum system at the car places and it would save me money in the long run but the suction power is pretty weak and it doesn't really get the car floors clean of crumbs, dirt and other debris. It's sitting in my closet unused. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: vcwatson

customer_reviews.title: Died within 20 minutes of use, now I can't return it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in my camper. I didn't use my camper for a couple months so it literally sat in a box on the shelf unopened. First time plugging it in and using it in the camper, it died within about 20 minutes of use. Because it sat on the shelf, now I can't return it or even get it replaced. I bought it because of the price, but I would have been better off spending more and getting something like an actual shop vac brand.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie Collette

customer_reviews.title: Died in 3 months :(
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work alright but tried to use it last night and it wouldn't turn on. Tried multiple outlets and nothing. Would hope that this would last more than 3 months without needing replacement. Funny thing is we barely even used it and when we did it was for dry trash, maybe once with a liquid mess so would expect normal dry use of any vacuum to last longer. Purchased July, dead in October which is past return time frame with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pet Stains
customer_reviews.text: My cat gets angry at me and she marks. My apartment is small and this vacuum works perfectly for both cleaning up wet stains and for regular vacuuming. WARNING: for some reason the foam attachment cover is very attractive to cats. We only used it once before my cat easily destroyed the foam attachment head (she clearly really enjoyed destroying it). The replacements are cheep and easy to find though so it wasn't a big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Shumira99

customer_reviews.title: Vacuums great
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum sucks up a lot of dirt for it being the size that it is! The suction power is enough to get the job done. The multiple attachments are work efficiently! The only attachment that’s a bit of an issue is the brush, the brush has a tendency to slid off sideways so it requires using both hands when using that attachment other than that I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Portable, not as big and loud as other units
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a specialized PC cleaning kit for cleaning filthy computers on the go and it works perfectly for my needs, not as loud as other units and much less expensive than vacs designed for IT use. My PC cleaning kit has a smaller adapted hose with wires inside which help to dissipate any possible static generated by a standard vac, very important for how I'm using it.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Dellea

product_meta.title: Armor All, AA255 , 2.5 Gallon 2 Peak HP Wet/Dry Utility Shop Vacuum
product_meta.description:
This Armor All Utility Vac is specifically designed to clean the interior of your car. It handles both wet and dry pickup, includes all accessories needed for complete interior cleaning and easily converts to a blower to dry motorcycles, car grills and wheels. It also has an automatic shut off to prevent overflow and a built in air and noise diffuser for efficient and quiet operation.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
ArmorAll's Utility Wet/Dry Vacs have the ability to clean up both solids and liquids, offering seemingly unlimited uses. The 2.5 gallon polypropylene tank is small enough to carry around, but large enough for most jobs. A 2 horsepower motor provides ample suction power, as well as an easy conversion to a blower function. Auto shut-off detects fill limit and prevents overflow. Top handle and onboard accessory storage make for easy carrying. Built-in air and noise diffuser minimizes volume. Other great features include a 10-foot cord with wrap, 6-foot, 1.25-inch hose, reusable cloth filter, reusable foam sleeve, 2-in-1 utility nozzle, crevice tool, deluxe car nozzle, blower nozzle, and detail brush. No assembly required.

Note: The hose is inside the canister portion (inside the units tank) of the vacuum.

specifications.Included Components: 6 Ft. x 1-1/4 Inch Hose, Reusable Cloth Filter, Foam Wet Filter, 2-in-1 Utility Nozzle with Brush, Crevice Tool, Deluxe Car Nozzle, Blower Nozzle with Adaptor, and Detail Brush
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars9,056 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
